title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 145-1.8 - Cancellation of certificates
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 145-1.8 - Cancellation of certificates

State Regulations

If an academic performance award is relinquished by the
holder, or if at any time it shall appear to the commissioner, upon evidence
deemed by the commissioner to be sufficient, that a holder of such award has
failed to comply with the regulations of the commissioner in respect to such
award or that an award heretofore or hereafter issued was issued through
mistake or contrary to law, the commissioner may make an order cancelling the
certificate, and thereupon such award shall become vacant and the person
holding the certificate therefor shall not thereafter be entitled to any
payments or benefits thereunder. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
§§
145-1.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
